title: Another font to identify.
content:
Trying to identify this font, it seems to have a slight serif to it, but this is very much minimized due to milling. Help would be appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [adamfenix.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819220206/http:/typophile.com/files/adamfenix.jpg) | 307.07 KB |
author: Sharkdog

comments.content:
There's actually some more text on the back that I didn't post, I could if it would help.

There's a P, and it leaves a small gap in the middle, and a G that doesn't have a serif that goes inwards towards the center.
Looks like Adobe Trajan to me.
